head.title: Blaze in Minneapolis Kills Four in a Family

hedline.hl1: Blaze in Minneapolis Kills Four in a Family

block.p: LEAD: Arson is suspected in a fire Saturday that killed a woman, two of her sons and a young man who was visiting them in an apartment house here.
LEAD: Arson is suspected in a fire Saturday that killed a woman, two of her sons and a young man who was visiting them in an apartment house here.
Arson is suspected in a fire Saturday that killed a woman, two of her sons and a young man who was visiting them in an apartment house here.
Another visitor was reported in critical condition, and six other people in the building escaped unharmed.
The dead were Carol Ann Kugel, 41 years old, her sons, Don Smith, 22, and Wayne Kugel, 10, and James Jackson, 21, all victims of smoke inhalation.
Mr. Jackson and his twin brother, Joseph, were visiting. Joseph Jackson was in critical condition at the Hennepin County Medical Center.
Police and fire officials are investigating the fire as a possible multiple homicide, said Police Sgt. Michael LaVine. He declined to provide details of why arson was suspected.

Mrs. Kugel's neighbors said she had three other children who were not home during the fire. ''They were a very good family and they never caused no trouble,'' said Janet Erickson, who said Mrs. Kugel was ''like a sister.''
